title:
Perturbation theory for resonant states near a bound state in the
  continuum
authors: Nan Zhang and Ya Yan Lu
abstract:
In this work, we develop a perturbation theory to analyze resonant states
near a bound state in the continuum (BIC) in photonic crystal slabs. The theory
allows us to rigorously determine the asymptotic behavior of $Q$-factor and the
far-field polarization. We show that the resonant states near a BIC can be
nearly circularly polarized if the scattering matrix is subject to a certain
condition. Moreover, our theory offers a novel perspective on super-BICs and
provides a clear and precise condition to efficiently identify them in both
symmetric and asymmetric structures without requiring a merging process. For
practical applications, we find a super-BIC in a square lattice of cylinders on
a dielectric substrate. Our theory addresses the non-Hermitian nature of the
system, can be generalized to treat other structures that support BICs, and has
potential applications in resonance and chiral optics.
